ovdesc.p: The rule based automatic status classification will be based on the conditions defined in this table. The account classification logic within T24 will be rule based, so that if there are any modifications (new documentation requirements, addition of new classifications, etc.), these can be easily handled by changing the rules set. The FATCA.STATUS in FATCA.CUSTOMER.SUPPLEMENTARY.INFO will be updated based on the conditions defined here, when AUTO.UPDATE is set as “YES” in FATCA.PARAMETER

desc.p: If this field is set to “YES”, then the owner status will also be considered in evaluating the account classification. Owners with role type JOINT / BENEFICIAL / SUBSTANTIAL will only be considered for evaluation.
If the field is blank then it will not be considered for status classification.
Validation rules
Allowed value is “YES”

The field is used to indicate whether the conditions above are applicable only to new clients or existing clients or both.

This will be determined by referring to the CUSTOMER SINCE field in CUSTOMER. If the date is on or after 1st July 2013, the relationship will be considered new else (even if the field is blank), the relationship will be considered existing. If the condition, for example, is specified only for New, the conditions specified here will not apply for Existing accounts.
When this field value is not updated, it will be considered as “BOTH”, it will be applicable to both New and Existing accounts.
Validation Rules:
NEW or EXISTING or BOTH
The ID will be a valid FATCA STATUS or Account classification defined in FATCA TAX STATUS.
Validation rules
A valid FATCA TAX STATUS ID
This field accepts one of the values defined in DEFLT.US.STATUS, DEFLT.NONUS.STATUS fields in FATCA.PARAMETER.

If the JO.BO.STATUS value is defined with a value specified in DEFLT.US.STATUS field of FATCA.PARAMETER, then the account with even one US Joint or beneficial or Substantial owner will be considered as US account.

If the JO.BO.STATUS value is defined with a value specified in DEFLT.NONUS.STATUS field of FATCA.PARAMETER, then the account with all non-us owners (Joint or beneficial or Substantial owner) will be considered as Non-US account.
Validation Rules:

p.p: Mandatory when CHECK.JO.BO.STATUS is set as “YES”
Must be a valid value from the FATCA.TAX.STATUS application.

desc.p: If this field is set to YES, only clients with KYC checks completed (KYC CHECK field in FATCA CUSTOMER record set to YES), will be considered to have complied with this rule. If this field is left blank, then the value of KYC check field will not be considered for status classification.
Validation rules
The allowed values are YES or NO
Level will be used to group the conditions and evaluate based on the condition level.
When no value is specified it will be considered as previous conditions level value.
An example is provided below:

p.p: To be considered a non-US account, the client has to provide W-8BEN or FGN.PASSPORT. In this case, the Level field will be blank.

If the requirement is to provide (W-8BEN-E and FIN.REPORT) or (OWNER.CONFIRMATION), then W-8BEN-E and FIN.REPORT can be set as LEVEL 1 (to be evaluated together) and OWNER CONFIRMATION as LEVEL 2 (this will be evaluated after Level 1 has been evaluated and no match has been found).
